title: I LOVE IT! Suggestions!
text: Hi! I love subway surfers, and love the characters and graphics. It helps me reach for a goal (the goal being to beat my high score.) It definitely has kept me entertained during quarantine, even though I have my moments where I get angry and turn it off, (I have a anger management problem) But I go back and play it even more. Iâ€™d love it more if there were more maps you could unlock. Like instead of (Im guessing) a map looking like New York (the current one) How about one on the beach side, Or safari, with golf carts as the â€œtrainsâ€. Or when you unlock a new character thereâ€™s a story to tell you more about the character, Like frank, he looks like a business man, maybe a spy. Just something that would be like a backstory to the characters. Love the game, Iâ€™m addicted to it! Keep it up.

title: Love it but thereâ€™s an issue
text: Ok so this game is phenomenal. I love how they include all nations and people groups. The characters and hoverboards look cool even though they cost a lot (but only a couple things are actual money). Since this is a game you can play without WiFi, itâ€™s fun to play in the car or another place with no internet. However, my account has a problem. I used to play on another device, but when I switched the account to my new one, some items I had recently bought didnâ€™t make it over (and they were still on the other device). Also, I can only collect coins from runs, none of the prizes I get from mystery boxes count. Itâ€™s frustrating and I would very much like that to be fixed. Sorry for the length of this I just wanted to make myself clear. Have a good day and keep making this game better!!!

title: Few suggestions
text:
The game is fun and actually pretty good, but something that really frustrates me is that there is no way to have saved data. Like, if someone got a new device to play on and wanted to have the same data from before, they couldnâ€™t â€œmoveâ€ their progress to a new device. I think if accounts were an option on the game, it would be a lot better. Accounts don't have to be a mandatory thing, but it could be an option for the players in case they wanted to login on another device and have the same progress.
Theres also a bug on the game where sometimes when I move to the right or left lane, its like bumping into something and the cop catches up again. This can make it a lot easier to lose the round and is very frustrating sometimes.
I think those are my biggest complaints.

title: Cool game, not good for kids
text:
Subway surfers is a fun game, to be sure, but parents should be very cautious.  

1) you MUST agree to disclose your personal device data to their ad network in order to play.  I applaud them for making that blatantly apparent, but thereâ€™s no telling what their ad network partners do with it.  

2) at least one way that they use that data in game to serve WAAAAY too many ads in my opinion.  Show an ad maybe before or after playing a game, no problem.  But this game shows ads while just browsing through menus (of which there are many).  Not only does this make for a poor user experience, it just seems greedy.   

3) several of the video ads I saw had a â€œfalse xâ€ in the top right corner.  Those are out there to give the appearance (especially to children) that the user can press the X to close the ad.  You canâ€™t.  Pressing that X is just like clicking the ad.  The times I saw it, the ads were for other games, so it would open the App Store.  I think this is borderline fraudulent and something Apple should be monitoring.   

So yes, the game is very fun.  I just donâ€™t think the way ads are treated here that this game should be considered kid friendly and the age rating should be changed.  At the very least give me an option to pay for the game and remove ads and data tracking.  If that option exists in this game, I did not see it.

title: Fun Gameplay/Great Colorful Graphics
text:
This is a Great game that is really addicting. I am one of those people who makes fun of the idea of mobile gaming. I love pic games and nintendo systems. This game, However, is fun. It isn't complicated, but that is why its so fun. When I feel like relaxing and shutting off my brain for a while, I play this (or sleep lol) This is a great game that I definetaly suggest.

The other aspect of this game that I love is the colorful backgrounds and characters. The game sets up new settings and upgrades all the time. When Im writing this comment, the game currently has an Asian themed setting with a new character, hover board option, and new missions. This si one of the best mobile games I have played, maybe even the best. I'm not crazy for mobile games but this one I rate 5 stars NO DOUGHT!!!!!

title: Best Game Ever
text:
I think Subway Surf is one of the best games that you can get from this app store. Itâ€™s got so many amazing qualities that you just donâ€™t really find in new apps. 

Whenever I discover a new fun app I always end up deleting it a few days later because itâ€™s riddled with ads. Subway Surf actually is really good about NOT shoving ads down your throat. Youâ€™ll hardly even notice them. Plus, i donâ€™t even mind them because Kiloo deserves the revenue.

The animation is top notch! Itâ€™s full of beautiful vibrant colors and really fun details. I love going through the subway and noticing small flowers or decorations. The characters are really fun and have lots of personality.

Kiloo does a few things to keep gameplay really fun. First, every month the game in set at a subway in a different city all around the world. Itâ€™s really cool to move around like that. Second, you can collect power ups in the game to give you advantages in the run. You can also collect coins that you can use to buy characters and hover boards with.

The game is perfect. Simple enough to understand, and hard enough to stay challenging for years. They donâ€™t shove ads down your face and the design is eye candy.
Perfection.

title: The new upgrade is SOOOO bad!
text: When ever I start running the surfer becomes super glitchy and not as smooth as before the update. Many times my run has been cut short because the game froze, then glitched so that my character ran into an obstacle. I didnâ€™t have a choice to update, the developers just auto-updated the app. The new graphics of the app are just so childish and waaay over cartoon-y. Another problem I have is that a red notification bubble stays in the top right corner of the â€œQuestsâ€ bubble. I click to see why there is a notification, and the bubble is proclaiming that I have completed 4 achievements. Iâ€™ve scrolled up and down and I have no achievement prizes unclaimed. The bubble is really annoying me and is very bothersome. The only other thing is that I hate how you have to scroll up and down to see the characters, rather than swiping right and left like before. Other than that the app is basically the same.

title: Simple yet captivatingâ€¦
text: I used to play subway surfers about 3 years ago, and recently picked it back up. I really like a lot of the changes, such as the daily highscore and coin meter. On the contrary, the ads for revive feels like it should still have a key cost. High scores just feel false because you can revive so many times by just watching videos. The numerous ads while at the start screen are also irritating. The only other issue I have had is randomly my character will stumble while surfing side-to-side on top of trains. All complaints/bugs aside this is still an amazing game, and overall it has improved since I played 3 years ago. I would love to hear from the developer about any improvements that could be made in the aforementioned areas.

title: I donâ€™t understand anything
text:
I know Iâ€™m kind of late to reviewing this update but I just started playing after a few months finishing school.

I know this game isnâ€™t exactly aimed at older people and that it is technically a kids game. However those that have been playing this game since 2012 thatâ€™s actually still play are somewhat hurt and disappointed with the visual update. Visuals arenâ€™t the problem though, with this update the game is slower to load and a little laggy while playing. The FB thing was said to be fixed however Iâ€™ve been signed out and donâ€™t even have the option to sign back in, my first thought was maybe they removed the ability to connect with Facebook but that doesnâ€™t really make sense. I donâ€™t want to sit and complain because the basic game I grew up with is still here but so much has changed and it sorta broke the game.

title: Incredible
text: Seeing a game that ages well is pretty rare now a days, been playing it since the iPod touch and still playing to this date. Deleted and then downloading it and starting from scratch is annoying since the game should already be synced with the game center but i still manage to play and play to get the characters back. Nonetheless a very fun game especially when itâ€™s Christmas themed their is something special about that since the og game was first redesigned for a Christmas theme, very fun to play while in the bus or in those long parking lot waits and thanks to the development team that puts so much time to always introducing something new. But for the love of God make the game sync with game center all of the characters and boards. But still giving it a 5 star.

title: Awesome subways surfers
text: Subway surfers is an outstanding game adds Donâ€™t come up as much and this game is high-quality with the right amount of coins and keys!I Play this game every day when I get home from school I will get on my device and play subway surfers! About every month they change the setting which is very cool this game gets more skins and rewards!!You can get a high score and they give you a reward for that I think that if I could change anything about this game I would change how slow it goes in the beginning but it gets faster which is good!!! This game puts a smile on my face whenever I play it . I would say this game was made in Very great and detailed and worth trying! I really recommend this game to people that love action and traction!!!!!

Iâ€™ve played this game since back in 2012. Before it was a fun game where youâ€™re trying to beat your friends scores and at the same time earn a ton of coins to buy the super nice skins. Today, as of 2019, this game has turned into more of an individual and forgive me but boring game because one doesnâ€™t even play to earn the in game credits. All one can do is constantly watch 30 second adds and earn much more than one would have earned by playing the game itself. It is possible that such decision has been made by the creators due to the demise in popularity and profit from the game (definitely less than in 2013 but it is still up #7 in Action Games in App Store). Iâ€™ve always loved the gameplay and the game itself. I hope that it doesnâ€™t continue going in the same direction. I hope it will not continue to be just about money making, I really do.
